title: After taking out Mandel Nallo at Bellator 231, Killys Mota ready for the big names in the lightweight division
text:
UNCASVILLE, Conn. – Killys Mota got back in the win column in impressive fashion and says he’s ready for the next step up in competition.

Mota (12-1 MMA, 1-0 BMMA) took out fellow rising prospect Mandel Nallo in the third round at Bellator 231 on Friday, chopping him down with brutal leg kicks. In Round 3, Nallo had absorbed too much damage to his leg and was unable to get his footing when he rolled his ankle and stumbled onto his back.

That was the beginning of the end for Nallo. The kicks were part of the game plan for Mota, a Glover Teixeira protege, and he was able to execute them to perfection.

“He kicked him in the first round, he saw that he felt it, and when he started kicking it in the third, and he started believing in the kick, he knew the kick was going to finish him,” Teixeira translated for Nallo after the fight at Mohegan Sun Arena in Uncasville, Conn.

“I watched his last fight. I saw he has good kicks, he has two KOs in Bellator, a lot of kicks, one knee, one head kick – and my game for this fight was leg kicks and wrestling,” Mota said. “He has good legs – he showed me. I believe in my kicks.”

Mota suffered his first career blemish when he fell short of capturing the vacant LFA lightweight title against Austin Hubbard in 2018. After a fast start, stumbling Hubbard on numerous occasions, Mota gassed out and Hubbard was able to take control of the fight.

Mota was finished with just 15 seconds left in the contest in a fight that many believed should have been stopped long before since he was taking a beating.

But Mota is past that loss, a fight that taught him some valuable lessons. He was able to rebound with a big win in his Bellator debut on Friday, and already has aspirations of competing against the division’s best.

“I think this is normal,” Mota said of his first career loss. “I love training, I love fighting, I love everything. My last fight didn’t switch anything in my mind, switched nothing in my life. I kept focused, I kept training, and I train with the best guys – Glover Teixeira, I have a good team. (At) Teixiera MMA, I have everything I need.”

And while he thinks Nallo was a formidable opponent, he’s ready for the next level, and wants to take on the top 155-pound contenders.

“My next goal is the best in the division, (fight) the big names in my division,” Mota said. “I’m the champion – I’m the next champion, not Nallo. I respect (Patricky) ‘Pitbull’ (Freire), I respect the guys in my division. I respect, but that’s my dream, man.”
description: After taking out Mandel Nallo at Bellator 231, Killys Mota believes he's ready for the big names in the lightweight division.
